B1.title: Part 2: New Public Park
B1.transcript: Good evening. The city council has announced plans to build a new public park in the north of the city. The park will include walking paths, a children’s playground and an outdoor sports area. Local residents have welcomed the idea, saying it will improve the quality of life in the neighbourhood. However, some people are worried about increased traffic and noise during construction. The project is expected to begin early next year.

C1.title: Part 2: The Future of Work
C1.transcript: In recent years, remote work has shifted from being a temporary solution to becoming a long-term strategy for many organisations. While employees often report increased flexibility and improved work–life balance, employers remain divided on its long-term effectiveness. Some managers argue that reduced face-to-face interaction can weaken collaboration and company culture. Others, however, claim that productivity can actually improve when employees are given greater autonomy. As companies continue to experiment with hybrid models, the debate over the future of work shows no sign of being resolved.
